Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Hmm, this is an interesting process analysis task. The user provided an event log for a Procure-to-Pay process and wants me to identify anomalies based on standard business practices.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I need to carefully examine each case while keeping in mind the typical P2P sequence: requisition approval PO goods receipt invoice matching payment closure. The standard practice requires approval before PO issuance, goods receipt after PO, and invoice matching before payment.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1002, I notice the payment was released before approval and goods receipt - that's a major red flag for fraud risk.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Case 1003 shows payment before invoice and goods receipt, which suggests paying for undelivered goods.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Case 1004 has goods receipt before PO issuance, indicating possible unauthorized receiving.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I should explain each anomaly clearly, highlighting why it violates standard practices and what risks it poses. The response should be structured case by case for clarity, with a summary at the end.
